description: TO POSTPONE INDEFINITELY THE H. J. RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND THE SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE BE DIRECTED TO ADJOURN THEIR RESPECTIVE HOUSES FROM SATURDAY DEC. 22ND UNTIL WEDNESDAY THE 2ND OF JAN.  (P.565)

TO RECOMMIT AN AMENDMENT TO H.R. 26 TO A SELECT COMMITTEE WHICH AMENDMENT WOULD MAKE THE RATIO 39,900 INSTEAD OF 42,000.  (P.907)
TO AMEND H. R. 26, BY REDUCING THE RATIO OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM 50,000 TO 42,000 IN ACCORDANCE WITH THE FOURTH CENSUS. (P.925)

TO RECOMMIT H. R. 26  TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE.  (P.939
TO PASS H. R. 26.  (P.947)

TO CONSIDER A JOINT RESOLUTION PROVIDING TO FIX THE TIME FOR THE ADJOURNMENT OF THE PRESENT SESSION AT THE FIRST MONDAY IN NEXT APRIL.  (P.1250)

TO AMEND H. R. 1, A BILL TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY THROUGHOUT THE U. S., BY PROVIDING FOR ADMITTING OTHERS THAN MERCHANTS TO AVAIL THEMSELVES OF THE BENEFIT OF THE LAW TO ESTABLISH A UNIFORM SYSTEM OF BANKRUPTCY.  (P. 1276)

TO AMEND H. R. 1, BY PROVIDING THAT NO CERTIFICATE OF DIS- CHARGE UNDER THE PROVISIONS OF THE ACT, SHALL OPERATE TO DISCHARGE ANY BANKRUPT FROM ANY DEBT, EXCEPT SUCH AS MAY BE DUE OR OWING TO PERSONS WHO MAY BE LIABLE TO BECOME BANK- RUPT UNDER THE ACT. (P.1277)

TO AMEND H. R. 1, BY PROVIDING THAT ALL CLASSES OF THE COM- MUNITY ARE TO HAVE THE PRIVILEGES AT THEIR ELECTION OF BECOMING VOLUNTARY BANKRUPTS WITH THE CONSENT OF A MAJOR PART IN VALUE OF ALL CREDITORS AND SUCH BANKRUPTS BE SUB- JECTED TO THE SAME PROCEDINGS AS PROVIDED ALL OTHER BANKRUPTS
